pageTitle: Track improvement between Wimbledon and Putney Bridge

title.title: Track improvement between Wimbledon and Putney Bridge

texts: Essential track improvement work will be taking place on the Wimbledon branch of the District line on Saturday and Sunday 21 and 22 May.
The work is being undertaken by Metronet SSL.
There will be no District line service between Putney Bridge and Wimbledon on either day but two special bus services will operate:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["\u003cstrong\u003eSaturday 21 May\u003c/strong\u003e \u003cstrong\u003ebr\u003c/strong\u003e Between East Putney and Putney Bridge\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eService B \u003c/strong\u003e Towards Wimbledon: Parsons Green to Wimbledon via Southfields and Wimbledon Park\u003cbr /\u003eTowards Central London: Wimbledon to Fulham Broadway via Wimbledon Park and Southfields\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e","\u003cstrong\u003eSunday 22 May\u003c/strong\u003e Between East Putney and Putney Bridge\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eService B\u003c/strong\u003e Putney Bridge to Wimbledon via Southfields and Wimbledon Park"]}
Passengers for Putney and Wimbledon may find it more convenient to use South West Trains services from Waterloo.
Passengers for Southfields, Wimbledon Park and Wimbledon should change onto the replacement bus service at Putney Bridge.
Valid Underground tickets will be accepted on local bus route numbers: 39,93,156/N77 and 493.
Passengers should allow an extra 30 minutes to complete their journeys.
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Metronet SSL is responsible for the maintenance and renewal of the Circle, District, East London, Hammersmith \u0026 City and Metropolitan lines.\u003cbr /\u003e"]}
